citations.query: directive fine-tuning white-box models knowledge integration method
citations.raw_result:
Directive fine-tuning is an innovative method for integrating knowledge into white-box models, as introduced by PKG [75]. In this approach, the traditional retriever module is directly substituted to generate relevant documents according to a given query. This method addresses challenges encountered during conventional fine-tuning processes, particularly when integrating external knowledge into models with transparent, interpretable architectures. By enabling the model to generate contextually relevant documents on-demand, directive fine-tuning enhances performance without requiring separate retrieval components or external knowledge bases during inference. This technique facilitates a more seamless and efficient alignment between the modelâ€™s internal parameters and the external knowledge it needs to access, improving accuracy and adaptability in knowledge-intensive tasks.
